For those of you who can get past its old-style graphics and the soldier's stunted dialogue, Half-Life is an awesome game! Some say it's even better than Half-Life 2, and I agree with them, even though I consider HL2 to be one of the best games out there. Though it doesn't have a physics engine, it's got plenty of nerve-wracking puzzles that'll kill you if you get 'em wrong, a decent story and lots of strategical elements, such as det-packs, laser mines and a stealth mode for sneaky assasinations. However, if you do get the game, I've got to warn you about a certain glitch which you may or may not experience. If you get to a certain point and the game suddenly crashes, restart it and, when you walk through that area again, make sure that your crowbar is equipped and your flashlight is off. This should fix it. Other than that, it's an awesome game!
El mejor juego del mundo, su historia, su trama, todo es espectacular.

The birth of a whole new type of gaming experience. The first of its kind in too many ways to count. The title that revolutionized its industry. If you have even the slightest interest in games and/or games development, you need to play this game all the way through. Nothing quite like it has come out since.

Not a bad all game. Its pretty old now but back in 98 there was nothing like it , If your into old PC gaming like my self  i would highly recommend it. only problem is there are no servers for multiplayer .

Of the games i've ever played this will forever hold that spot as my Number One favorite game of all time. It was the first game to hold a solid story line and lauched a game that provided a true gameplay expirence. 

The time required to play through the campaign (if you have never done it before) is very good for a game of the time, as are the graphics. thing about the game is that it came from a time in gaming history where no one cared about graphics, the players wanted story - the exact oppisite of modern gaming.

all in all - buy it its worth the money

If you have even the slightest interest on FPS games, you need to play Half Life. Thanks to it´s amazing gameplay and immersive atmosphere, Half Life manages to suck you into it´s world. It´s mention worthy that some of the environments in this game blew my mind, as well that weapons are extremely fun to use. Sound design is also stellar and memorable. I will never forget the medical station healing sound, that´s for sure!
At last, the AI of the enemies is awesome. Soldiers are a challenge to fight because they cooperate, throw grenades at you when you take cover, and run for their lives when they are about to die. Play this. Now.

Da primeira vez em na qual soube que Half-Life era da Valve (até então, achava que Portal e TF2 resumia seu histórico de jogos famosos) eu falei para mim mesmo: Tenho que jogar. Apesar da temática do jogo não ter absolutamente nada a ver comigo (headcrabs nojentos que transformam suas vítimas em zumbis e vortiagunts asquerosos, além de cenas de terror) eu o joguei por "obrigação". Não me arrependi com este ótimo precurssor dos FPS e espero que este trunfo dure mais anos nas mentes dos jogadores. Recomendo.

1/24/2021 update:

I just want to pay respects to this game another time. I consider it the best piece of work ever made due to personal reasons. This game, along with 3 certain friends (we don't really talk anymore but I hope you guys are still doing good these days) I made on Sven Co-op shaped who I am today. Going back brings me memories and good feelings. The fact that Valve finally made a new installment known as Half-Life: Alyx finally completes a chapter in my life. This franchise is the most important piece of media and no matter what anyone says, I'm glad the series was created and I'm glad Alyx came out after all these years. Thank you Valve again. You helped save my life with your games AND gained my respect once again with your newest game.

April 16th 2019:

Thank you Valve for making this game. It really has affected my life and many others in a great way. My childhood wouldn't be the same without the game, it made me really happy. When I was younger, I would like to play mods like They Hunger and Sven-Coop or even Azure Sheep. Looking back, I can't express how much I appreciate this game for what it has done for me on a personal level.

 Even past the more nostalgic moments, it's still a damn good game. If you have never played it, do yourself a favor and BUY IT. I mean the game is over 20 years old and still holds up in terms of pacing, game play, and story. It really will always have the title of being a masterpiece, especially for what it represents in gaming. On sale, it literally sells for a DOLLAR. I really could go on about this game and even nitpick parts I don't really enjoy today but I'll just leave it here. Half-Life is one of the greatest games ever made, and you need to play it if you haven't.

Once again, even with Valve 100% not being the same company at all, obviously, since they don't even make games anymore, thank you for everything you've done especially with this game right here.

This is one of my top games of all time.  It was one of the first games that I actually remember caring about the story.  It was an extremely tight shooter with a mulitiude of different environments, enemies, and weapons.  Valve also introduced quite a few first person physics/world puzzles.  It's a unique flair and they still managed to create a "boss fight" that will forever live on in my mind.

Upon arriving late to work one summer's morn, a practitioner of scientific enlightenment was greeted with surliness from his cohorts. For today was a very special day. A day with absolutely no room for tardiness or incongruity. 

Deep within the Black Chamber of Wonderment, a magic crystal had been sent forth from a G-rand old wizard. Our hero's task was to manipulate said crystal into the Gloriously Glimmering Gizmo - which he did with earnest.

But alas, it was all a duplicitous scheme configured by that pale G-rand Wizard.

Our hero was thrown hither and thither, gazing upon beings which reside within the cosmos unknown. Then suddenly, darkness.

Awakening back in the chamber, your challenge is to guide our hero topside out of the newly wrought wreckage. Ahead of you lies peril, betrayal and a galactic menace. 

With only a pry bar at hand, will you survive?

An astonishment in electronic entertainment. Until you've frolicked with Freeman, consider your Life-Half lived.

Of  course the base game is great (and the expansion packs), but there are also so many great mods made using Half-Life. To name a few:

Sven-Coop - Adds online coop to the game. This includes all expansions and 1000s of custom maps.
Brain Bread - Colourful and crazy online zombie coop game.
Natural Selection - Aliens vs marines, competative online play, class based FPS/RTS hybrid
